intro: Diplotaxis variabilis, commonly known as the variable diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often have a distinctive hairy texture. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, arid environments.
